parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Erratic Idle and High RPM Issues
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The erratic idle and high RPM issues can cause the vehicle to be difficult to control, especially at low speeds, which can lead to accidents or near-miss situations.
symptoms: The engine idle speed jumps randomly
hangs up at a high RPM
or fails to idle properly
resulting in unsafe riding conditions. The problem is often more pronounced at higher ambient temperatures.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Fuel System Incompatibility and Engine Stalling
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The stalling of the engine at high speeds can cause sudden, unexpected deceleration, loss of brakes, and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The engine stalls at speeds above 50mph
sudden deceleration
loss of power-assisted brakes
engine surging when the throttle is held at a constant speed
failure to decelerate when the throttle is released.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The faulty fuel level sensor can cause the fuel gauge to malfunction, leading to inaccurate fuel level readings, which can result in running out of fuel on the highway or at intersections, potentially causing fatal accidents.
symptoms: The fuel gauge does not work
the fuel level reading is inaccurate
the vehicle runs out of fuel unexpectedly
the fuel level sensor fails repeatedly.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Erratic Engine Idle and Throttle Response
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The erratic engine idle and throttle response can cause the motorcycle to behave unpredictably, leading to a loss of control, accidents, and safety risks, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: High engine idle speed
unresponsive deceleration when the throttle is closed
rough or "bucking" at constant cruising speeds (around 60 mph)
inconsistent engine performance
and loss of control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A constantly illuminated brake warning light can be distracting and may lead to driver confusion, potentially causing accidents or near-misses. Additionally, if the light is not accurately indicating a brake issue, it may mask a real problem, further compromising safety.
symptoms: The brake warning light on the dashboard remains constantly illuminated
despite no apparent brake issues
and cannot be reset or turned off by the dealer or owner.
